alert.note: Alert for Gilchrist (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 4:54PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Gilchrist and west central Alachua Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 454 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northwest of Archer, or 10 miles east of Trenton, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Trenton, High Springs and Newberry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
